tool.name: Lsi

param.name: aoi
param.dialogReference: The area of interest where the landslide susceptibility risk will be calculated.

param.name: location
param.dialogReference: Select "Europe" or "Global" to indicate whether the AOI is located inside or outside Europe. This is used to define the methodology to be used (for, more information about each methodology please check the gitlab).

param.name: method
param.dialogReference: If location=Europe the ELSUS method is used. "Refined" will compute LSI from scratch based on this method while "Fast" will take the default ELSUS layer, clipped by AOI and resampled.

param.name: landcover
param.expression: ESA WorldCover - 2021 (10m) | Corine Land Cover - 2018 (100m) | Global Land Cover - Copernicus 2019 (100m)
param.dialogReference: Select the LULC that will be used to compute the landslide risk.

param.name: dem
param.dialogReference: Select the DEM that will be used to compute the landslide risk.

param.name: dem_raster
param.dialogReference: In case of dem=Other, provide the link to the optional DEM to be used for the LSI computations.

param.name: output_folder
param.dialogReference: Directory for saving the outputs and temporary files.

param.name: temp_folder
param.dialogReference: Choose whether you prefer to keep or erase the temporary files (Lithology, LULC, Slope, Distance to river layers, etc.) after the LSI computation.

param.name: jenks_class
param.dialogReference: Choose whether you want to apply a Jenks Breaks classification. If Yes, a vectorization of the final result will also be provided.

tool.summary:
Landslide Susceptiblity Index (LSI)

The Global method is computed based on the layers: Lithology, Elevation, Slope, LULC, Hydro (Distance to river) and Aspect.

The Europe method is computed based on the layers: Lithology, Slope, LULC and Climate-physiographically differentiated zones.
